Held talks with Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi; as with Tarja Halonen and Angela Merkel before her, we discussed visas.
Like many other European countries, Italy fully supports the idea of visa-free travel between Russia and the EU.
Silvio Berlusconi promised to get personally involved in work on this issue. We hope the process won't take too long.

"Good Morning President". I appreciated it yesterday at the invitation of the organizer. While comedy touched, it is an outstanding work depicting the conflict of the leader who is shaking in the gap between the way of life as a state leader and the way of life as an individual. I was made to think about various things. On the other hand, it seems a little uncomfortable for Japanese view in the work.

Is outlining Labor’s plan for a better health system. Stream it here http://tinyurl.com/29f6f6t My Team will update you with snippets. JG
I lead a government that is determined to tackle the long-term challenge of providing better health services for the future.
Today I would like to set out Labor’s plan to redouble our efforts for tackling suicide.
We will boost frontline services in communities for people at greatest risk of suicide in our community
We will give priority to men - who we know are often at greater risk and less likely to seek help
We will promote resilience and good mental health for both our young children and our young people
RT @AustralianLabor: Labor invests in mental health and measures to tackle suicide: Fact Sheets http://bit.ly/9Wv4sJ #ausvotes

In Melbourne today giving a major speech on our National Disability Strategy. My Team will keep you updated with snippets. JG
You can stream the speech here http://tinyurl.com/29f6f6t
There is much more to be done in our journey of inclusion and reform. Today I announce another step forward: a National Disability Strategy.
The National Disability Strategy will help us create better services, programs and community infrastructure
A re-elected Gillard Labor Government will take the draft National Disability Strategy to COAG early in the next term.
Today I announce the Better Start for Children with Disabilities program.
We will provide up to $12000 for early intervention services for each child.
We will also make available a range of new diagnosis and treatment services for older children with those conditions – funded by Medicare.
Today I also announce an additional investment providing up to 150 additional places in Supported Accommodation.
It is a great honor. http://sankei.jp. msn.com/life/trend/100729/trd1007290501003-n1.htm

I think that the net will demonstrate strong power to bring the distance between the people and politics closer. With that capability, I hope to help not only Nagatacho, Kasumigaseki but also individuals, NPOs, companies, regions and others cooperate in a more flat relationship and create a society that is responsible for "new public" .

National projects have proved to be an effective way to address many problems. Today we discussed the general outline for key programmes.
Two important issues today are healthcare, where we've made some progress, and energy efficiency, where we're still lagging behind.
Conserving resources and using them wisely are global trends we should follow.
It's not enough to be computer savvy and know foreign languages. A truly modern person needs to know how to be energy efficient, too.
An energy efficient lifestyle is becoming popular in developed countries. It's a good idea - one we should take note of.
